lines.content: * Duke is a personal chatbot assistant to help you organize your tasks. Especially helpful
* for people who love to procrastinate. Or procrastinate to procrastinate.
* Constructor of the Duke chatbot assistant.
* Duke is able to perform CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Destroy) to manage tasks.
* @param filePath A text file which functions as a database to store all tasks.
// You will need to import `javafx.scene.layout.Region` for this.
//Scroll down to the end every time dialogContainer's height changes.
* Starts the Duke bot by receiving user input, and stores all the data to the database
* The main driver function of Duke.
* @param args The command line arguments entered by the user.
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A Deadline is a special kind of task that needs to be done before a specific time.
* @param description A string with the details of the deadline.
* @param by A string that represents a time.
* Constructor overloading, with a date as time.
* @param description A string with the details of the deadline.
* A getter method to access the time of this deadline.
* @return A string that represents a time.
* Gives a string representation of the deadline, with the details and the time best before.
* @return A string representation of the deadline.
* A special exception used by the Duke to alert its users.
* A Duke exception which warns about input and output errors.
return "OOPS! Something is wrong with the input/output.";
* A Duke exception which shuts down the Duke.
* An event is a special kind of task that needs to be done at a specific point of time.
* Constructor of an event, similar to a Tasks's.
* @param description The description of an event.
* @param at the specific time or date that this event takes place.
* An overloading constructor with a special date parameter.
* @param description The description of an event.
* @param todoDate The date that this event takes place.
* A getter method to access the time of the event.
* @return A string denoting the event's time.
* Shows the string representation of the event, with the description and the time.
* @return A string representation of the event.
* A Duke Exception which warns the users that arguments are not enough.
return "OOPS, the arguments are not enough!";
* A Duke exception to warn users that deadline format are invalid.
* Constructor that warns the user with a message.
* @param message The string to be shown.
* A string representation of this exception with the message.
* A Duke exception that warns users that the event format is invalid.
* A constructor that warns the user with a mesage.
* @param message The string to be shown.
* A string representation of this exception with the message.
* A Duke exception that warns users when entering invalid indexes.
* @param message The message to be shown to the user.
* A string representation of this exception as a message.
* @return The message to warn the user.
* A Duke exception that warns users when entering invalid commands.
* A string representation of the exception.
* @return A specific message to warn the user.
return "OOPS! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :/";
* A Duke exception to warn the users when creating invalid tasks.
* A string representation of the exception as a message.
* @return A specific message to warn the user about invalid task constructors.
return "OOPS! Description of Todo cannot be empty.";
* A Parser is the logic handling agent of the user's commands and database inputs when loading from it.
* The powerful thing of a parser is it does not rely on any external
* agent to perform the processing of inputs, just with pure logic.
* Processes every command line entered by the user. Users are able to enter
* bye, list, done x, find key, delete x, todo description, event description /at time,
* deadline description /by time, and any other inputs are deemed as invalid entries.
* @param command The string of command entered by the user.
* @param taskList The TaskList to process CRUD operations based on user input.
* @return An output denoting the success / failure of an operation.
* @throws DukeTerminateException Shuts down the Duke by entering "bye".
* @throws InsufficientInputException Not enough to arguments to find/delete/done.
* @throws InvalidIndexException Wrong indexes from TaskList's delete and done operations.
* @throws InvalidTodoException Invalid format of Task entered by the user.
* @throws InvalidEventException Invalid format of Event entered by the user.
* @throws InvalidDeadlineException Invalid format of Deadline entered by the user.
* @throws InvalidInputException Invalid commands entered by the user.
public String processCommand(String command, TaskList taskList) throws DukeTerminateException,

* Process tasks from the database to a list.
* @param line Every line of task from the database.
* @param storedTasks The list of task to load with.
public void processInputFromFile(String line, List<Task> storedTasks) {
* A logic function to determine the validity of a date entered.
* A date is a string in special format entered by the user to create deadlines/events.\
* @param str The string of date to be tested with.
* @return A boolean to denote this string is a date.
* A storage class that manages the accessing of all the tasks from the database.
* @param path the path that points to the location of the database, a text file.
* Loads all the previous tasks from the database into a temporary list.
* @return The list after the tasks are loaded.
* @throws DukeIOException The database is not found or a wrong location.
* Uploads the updated list of all files to the database upon Duke's termination.
* @param toStore The list of tasks that needs to be stored into the database.
* A Task is something that needs to be done by the user, at anytime.
* @param description The information about the task that needs to be done.
* Gets a status icon, a check or a cross based on the task's completion status.
* @return An icon of a check or a cross.
* A setter method for the task. Sets the task as done.
* A getter method to access the description of the task.
* @return The description of the task, without the status icon.
* A getter method to access the status of completion of the task
* @return Boolean value to determine if the task has been completed.
* A getter method to access the full description of the task
* @return A string denotes the description of the task, including the status icon.
* A complete information of the task, with a T prefix to denote that this is a task.
* @return A string representation of the task, with description and status icon.
* Stores a temporary list of current tasks of the user. TaskList is able to perform various
* operations, such as adding, updating, deleting, and even show all of them.
* Constructor. Starts with an empty list, if no previous tasks is left by
* Overriding constructor. If the user has any leftover incomplete tasks, includes them
* @param tasks The previous incomplete list of tasks by the user.
* Adds a task to the current list.
* @param task The current task that needs to be added into the list.
* @return An output specifying how many tasks the user has, after the adding.
String res = "Got it. I've added this task:" + "\n";
* Adds a deadline to the current list.
* @param deadline The deadline that needs to be added into the list.
* @return An output specifying how many tasks the user has, after the adding.
String res = "Got it. I've added this deadline:" + "\n";
* Adds an event to the current list.
* @param event The event that needs to be added into the list.
* @return An output specifying how many tasks the user has, after the adding.
String res = "Got it. I've added this deadline:" + "\n";
* Shows all the tasks, including those that are done or incomplete, to the user.
* @return A string that includes every task.
* Finds the task with a keyword requested by the user.
* @param key The keyword the user wants to search with.
* @return A string that includes all the tasks with the entered keyword.
String res = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:" + "\n";
* Marks a certain task as done upon completion.
* @param idx The index of the task that needs to be marked done.
* @return A string that shows the status of the updated task.
* @throws InvalidIndexException incorrect index, i.e. a negative number.
public String done(int idx) throws InvalidIndexException {

res += "Nice! I've marked this task as done:" + "\n";

public String delete(int idx) throws InvalidIndexException {

* This is the User Interface of the Duke. Accepts keyboard input from user,
* and shows the output after the operations.
* Ui Constructor. Has a Parser attribute to process inputs,
* and a Scanner to accept inputs. Shows a logo to greet the user.
* Starts the UI. The UI will continue to receive inputs, and terminates
* Prints a goodbye message to the user upon shutdown.
